p:
Out of an HTS, VE607 ( 33) was identified using a phenotype-based screen from a 50 240 structurally diverse small-molecule compound library. Pseudotype virus entry assay suggested VE607 can specifically inhibit SARS-CoV virus entry into cells with an EC 50 value of 3 μM and inhibited SARS-CoV plaque formation with an IC 50 of 1.6 μM.
132 A similar HTS approach was employed by Zhang et al. for screening a compound library consisting of 727 structurally diverse small molecules. eighty-four compounds were identified with significant anticoronavirus potential. Further studies revealed that 51 compounds inhibited virus entry, while 19 others interfered with viral replication.
133 Natural products should, however, be considered with caution due to their unknown mechanism of action and possible toxic side effects.
